analyzed: nga rgyal ni 'dod pa'i khams na yid bde ba dang / btang snyoms dang mtshungs par ldan no //
translated: Pride is associated with joy, sadness, and equanimity in the desire realm.

original: bsam gtan dang po dang gnyis pa la ni bde ba dang yid bde ba dang btang snyoms dang mtshungs par ldan no //
analyzed: bsam gtan dang po dang gnyis pa la ni bde ba dang yid bde ba dang btang snyoms dang mtshungs par ldan no //
translated: In the first and second absorptions, it is associated with pleasure, joy, and equanimity.

original: gsum pa la ni bde ba dang btang snyoms dang mtshungs par ldan no //
analyzed: gsum pa la ni bde ba dang btang snyoms dang mtshungs par ldan no //
translated: In the third absorption, it is associated with pleasure and equanimity.

original: de yan chad du ni btang snyoms kho na dang mtshungs par ldan no //
analyzed: de yan chad du ni btang snyoms kho na dang mtshungs par ldan no //
translated: Above that, it is associated only with equanimity.

original: nga rgyal ji lta ba de bzhin du 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang / mthar 'dzin par lta ba dang / lta ba mchog tu 'dzin par lta ba dang / tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: nga rgyal ji lta ba de bzhin du 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang / mthar 'dzin par lta ba dang / lta ba mchog tu 'dzin par lta ba dang / tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa yang de bzhin no //
translated: Just as with pride, so too with the afflicted view of the self, the view grasping an extreme, the view possessing esteem, and the view possessing adherence.

original: log par lta ba ni 'dod pa'i khams na yid bde ba dang yid mi bde ba dang / btang snyoms dang mtshungs par ldan no ;
analyzed: log par lta ba ni 'dod pa'i khams na yid bde ba dang yid mi bde ba dang / btang snyoms dang mtshungs par ldan no ;
translated: Wrong view is associated with joy, sadness, and equanimity in the desire realm.

original: / gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams na ni tshor ba gang yod pa de dang mtshungs par ldan no //
analyzed: / gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams na ni tshor ba gang yod pa de dang mtshungs par ldan no //
translated: In the realms of form and the formless, it is associated with whatever feeling exists there.

original: the tshom ni 'dod pa'i khams na yid mi bde ba dang / btang snyoms dang mtshungs par ldan no //
analyzed: the tshom ni 'dod pa'i khams na yid mi bde ba dang / btang snyoms dang mtshungs par ldan no //
translated: Doubt is associated with mental dissatisfaction and equanimity in the desire realm.

original: gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams na ni tshor ba gang yod pa de dang mtshungs par ldan no //
analyzed: gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams na ni tshor ba gang yod pa de dang mtshungs par ldan no //
translated: In the realms of form and the formless, it is associated with whatever feeling exists there.

original: ma rig pa ni nyon mongs pa thams cad dang mtshungs par ldan pa yin pas gang na tshor ba gang yod pa de dang der mtshungs par ldan pa can zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ma rig pa ni nyon mongs pa thams cad dang mtshungs par ldan pa yin pas gang na tshor ba gang yod pa de dang der mtshungs par ldan pa can zhes bya'o //
translated: Since ignorance is associated with all the afflictions, it is said to be associated with whatever feeling exists in a given realm.

original: ma rig pa ma 'dres pa gang yin pa de ni 'dod pa'i khams na yid mi bde ba dang btang snyoms dang mtshungs par ldan no //
analyzed: ma rig pa ma 'dres pa gang yin pa de ni 'dod pa'i khams na yid mi bde ba dang btang snyoms dang mtshungs par ldan no //
translated: Pure ignorance is associated with mental dissatisfaction and equanimity in the desire realm.

original: de yan chad du ni tshor ba gang yod pa de dang mtshungs par ldan no //
analyzed: de yan chad du ni tshor ba gang yod pa de dang mtshungs par ldan no //
translated: Above that, it is associated with whatever feeling exists there.

original: ci'i phyir nyon mongs pa thams cad btang snyoms dang mtshungs par ldan zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir nyon mongs pa thams cad btang snyoms dang mtshungs par ldan zhe na /
translated: Why is it that all the afflictions are associated with equanimity?

original: tha mal par 'dug pa la brten nas nub par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tha mal par 'dug pa la brten nas nub par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is lost when one returns to the ordinary state.

original: 'dod chags ni 'dod pa'i khams na rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug dang @84b mtshungs par ldan no //
analyzed: 'dod chags ni 'dod pa'i khams na rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug dang @84b mtshungs par ldan no //
translated: Desire is associated with the six groups of consciousness in the realm of desire.

original: 'dod chags ji lta bar khong khro ba dang ma rig pa yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: 'dod chags ji lta bar khong khro ba dang ma rig pa yang de bzhin no //
translated: As is desire, so are repugnance and ignorance.

original: gzugs kyi khams na ni rnam par shes pa'i tshogs bzhin dang mtshungs par ldan no //
analyzed: gzugs kyi khams na ni rnam par shes pa'i tshogs bzhin dang mtshungs par ldan no //
translated: In the realm of form, desire is associated with the four groups of consciousness.

original: gzugs med pa'i khams na ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i tshogs dang mtshungs par ldan no //
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i khams na ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i tshogs dang mtshungs par ldan no //
translated: In the formless realm, it is associated with the group of mental consciousness.

original: 'dod chags ji lta bar ma rig pa yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: 'dod chags ji lta bar ma rig pa yang de bzhin no //
translated: As is desire, so is ignorance.

original: nga rgyal dang / lta ba dang / the tshom ni thams cad du yang yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i tshogs dang mtshungs par ldan no //
analyzed: nga rgyal dang / lta ba dang / the tshom ni thams cad du yang yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i tshogs dang mtshungs par ldan no //
translated: Pride, false view and scepticism are associated with the group of mental consciousness everywhere.

original: 'dod chags dang / khong khro ba dang / nga rgyal ni 'dod pa'i khams na dngos po'i phyogs gcig la 'jug go //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang / khong khro ba dang / nga rgyal ni 'dod pa'i khams na dngos po'i phyogs gcig la 'jug go //
translated: Desire, repugnance and pride are applied to a part of the real.

original: 'dod pa'i khams na ji ltar bar gzugs kyi khams dang gzugs med pa'i khams na yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams na ji ltar bar gzugs kyi khams dang gzugs med pa'i khams na yang de bzhin no //
translated: The same holds for the realm of fine-materiality and the realm of immateriality.

original: lhag ma rnams ni thams cad du yang dngos po mtha' dag la 'jug go //
analyzed: lhag ma rnams ni thams cad du yang dngos po mtha' dag la 'jug go //
translated: The other proclivities are active with regard to all the categories of objects in all the realms.

original: ris kyis ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: ris kyis ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What are the classes of the proclivities?

original: nyon mongs pa'i ris gnyis te /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i ris gnyis te /
translated: There are two classes of proclivities:

original: mthong bas spang bar bya ba dang / bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'o //
analyzed: mthong bas spang bar bya ba dang / bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'o //
translated: those that are to be abandoned by insight into the truths, and those that are to be abandoned by cultivation.

original: 'dod pa'i khams na sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba dag ni bcu'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams na sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba dag ni bcu'o //
translated: In the realm of desire, there are ten proclivities to be abandoned by insight into the truth of unsatisfactoriness.

original: sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba ji lta bar kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang lam mthong bas spang bar bya ba rnams kyang de bzhin no //
analyzed: sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba ji lta bar kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang lam mthong bas spang bar bya ba rnams kyang de bzhin no //
translated: The same holds for the proclivities to be abandoned by insight into the truth of the origin, by insight into the truth of cessation, and by insight into the truth of the path.

original: gzugs kyi khams na sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba dag ni dgu'o //
analyzed: gzugs kyi khams na sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba dag ni dgu'o //
translated: In the realm of fine-materiality, there are nine proclivities to be abandoned by insight into the truth of unsatisfactoriness.

original: sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba rnams ji lta bar kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang lam mthong bas spang bar bya ba rnams kyang de bzhin no //
analyzed: sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba rnams ji lta bar kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang lam mthong bas spang bar bya ba rnams kyang de bzhin no //
translated: The same applies to the defilements to be abandoned through the vision of the origin of suffering, of the cessation of suffering, and of the path.

original: gzugs kyi khams na ji lta bar gzugs med pa'i khams na'ang de bzhin te /
analyzed: gzugs kyi khams na ji lta bar gzugs med pa'i khams na'ang de bzhin te /
translated: The same applies to the realm of immateriality.

original: de dag mdor bsdu na nyon mongs pa brgya rtsa bcu gnyis ni mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa'i ris so //
analyzed: de dag mdor bsdu na nyon mongs pa brgya rtsa bcu gnyis ni mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa'i ris so //
translated: In brief, the categories of defilements to be abandoned through the vision of the truths are one hundred and twelve in number.

original: 'dod pa'i khams na bsgom pas spang bar bya ba drug ste /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams na bsgom pas spang bar bya ba drug ste /
translated: In the realm of desire, there are six defilements to be abandoned through mental cultivation:

original: 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang / mthar 'dzin par lta ba lhan cig skyes pa dang / 'dod chags dang / khong khro ba dang / nga rgyal dang / ma rig pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang / mthar 'dzin par lta ba lhan cig skyes pa dang / 'dod chags dang / khong khro ba dang / nga rgyal dang / ma rig pa'o //
translated: the innate afflicted view of the self and the afflicted view of holding to an extreme, craving, hatred, pride and ignorance.

original: gzugs kyi khams na khong khro ba ma gtogs par lnga'o //
analyzed: gzugs kyi khams na khong khro ba ma gtogs par lnga'o //
translated: In the realm of form, there are five defilements, excluding hatred.

original: gzugs kyi khams na ji lta bar gzugs med pa'i khams na'ang de bzhin te /
analyzed: gzugs kyi khams na ji lta bar gzugs med pa'i khams na'ang de bzhin te /
translated: The same applies to the realm of immateriality.

original: de dag mdor bsdu na bcu drug ni bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa'i ris so //
analyzed: de dag mdor bsdu na bcu drug ni bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa'i ris so //
translated: In brief, these are the sixteen categories of defilements to be abandoned by cultivation.

original: spong bas ji ltar bu zhe na /üîΩji ltar spong ba dang yid la byed pa ci 'dra ba dang / @85a * //üîΩgang zhig gang las spong ba'o //
analyzed: spong bas ji ltar bu zhe na / ji ltar spong ba dang yid la byed pa ci 'dra ba dang / @85a * // gang zhig gang las spong ba'o //
translated: How are they abandoned?

original: ji ltar spong zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar spong zhe na /
translated: How are they abandoned?

original: yongs su shes pa dang / yongs su spong ba dang / gnyen po rnyed pas so //
analyzed: yongs su shes pa dang / yongs su spong ba dang / gnyen po rnyed pas so //
translated: Through complete knowledge, through renouncing, through obtaining the counteractives.

original: yongs su shes pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: yongs su shes pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is complete knowledge?

original: de'i gzhi'i dngos po yongs su shes pa dang / ngo bo nyid yongs su shes pa dang / nyes dmigs yongs su shes pa'o //
analyzed: de'i gzhi'i dngos po yongs su shes pa dang / ngo bo nyid yongs su shes pa dang / nyes dmigs yongs su shes pa'o //
translated: Complete knowledge of the thing which is the basis, complete knowledge of the intrinsic nature, complete knowledge of the disadvantages.

original: yongs su spong ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: yongs su spong ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is renouncing?

original: 'byung bar gyur pa dang du mi len pa'o //
analyzed: 'byung bar gyur pa dang du mi len pa'o //
translated: Not consenting to the arising of the defilements which have not already arisen.

original: gnyen po rnyed pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: gnyen po rnyed pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is obtaining the counteractives?

original: ma skyes pa spang ba'i phyir lam rnyed pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: ma skyes pa spang ba'i phyir lam rnyed pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: Obtaining the path which causes the defilements which have not yet arisen not to arise.

original: yid la byed pa ci 'dra bas spong zhe na /
analyzed: yid la byed pa ci 'dra bas spong zhe na /
translated: How are they abandoned?

original: 'dres pa la dmigs pas spong ste /
analyzed: 'dres pa la dmigs pas spong ste /
translated: Through attention to the mixed.

original: chos thams cad bdag med pa'o zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad bdag med pa'o zhes bya ba'o //
translated: All phenomena are devoid of self.

original: mi rtag pa'i rnam pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa gang yin pa de dag ni bdag med pa'i rnam pa'i yongs su sbyong bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: mi rtag pa'i rnam pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa gang yin pa de dag ni bdag med pa'i rnam pa'i yongs su sbyong bar byed pa'o //
translated: The aspects of impermanence, etc. are the purifications of the aspects of selflessness.

original: gang zhig gang las spong zhe na /
analyzed: gang zhig gang las spong zhe na /
translated: From what is it abandoned?

original: 'das pa ni 'gags pa'i phyir ma yin no //
analyzed: 'das pa ni 'gags pa'i phyir ma yin no //
translated: The past is not the cause of its abandonment, because it has already ceased.

original: ma 'ongs pa ni ma byung ba'i phyir ma yin no //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa ni ma byung ba'i phyir ma yin no //
translated: The future is not the cause of its abandonment, because it has not yet arisen.

original: de ltar byung ba ni lam dang mnyam du mi 'jug pa'i phyir ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar byung ba ni lam dang mnyam du mi 'jug pa'i phyir ma yin no //
translated: The present is not the cause of its abandonment, because it does not operate simultaneously with the path.

original: 'on kyang nyon mongs pa'i gnas ngan len gang la yod pa de las spong ngo //
analyzed: 'on kyang nyon mongs pa'i gnas ngan len gang la yod pa de las spong ngo //
translated: However, it is abandoned from that in which the negative reflex action of the defilement exists.

original: gnas ngan len gyi rnam pa gang gi gnyen po gang byung ba gnyen po'i rnam pa de 'byung ba dang / gnas ngan len gyi rnam pa de 'gog pa ni mnyam pas mnyam ste /
analyzed: gnas ngan len gyi rnam pa gang gi gnyen po gang byung ba gnyen po'i rnam pa de 'byung ba dang / gnas ngan len gyi rnam pa de 'gog pa ni mnyam pas mnyam ste /
translated: The arising of the aspect of the counteragent to whatever aspect of negative reflex action, and the cessation of that aspect of negative reflex action, are equal to the equalizing of the counteragent.

original: snang ba dang mun pa 'byung ba dang 'gog pa bzhin no //
analyzed: snang ba dang mun pa 'byung ba dang 'gog pa bzhin no //
translated: It is like the arising and cessation of light and darkness.

original: gnas ngan len gyi rnam pa dang / bral bas ma 'ongs pa na nyon mongs pa mi skye ba'i chos can du gnas pa de ni spong ba'o //
analyzed: gnas ngan len gyi rnam pa dang / bral bas ma 'ongs pa na nyon mongs pa mi skye ba'i chos can du gnas pa de ni spong ba'o //
translated: The abandonment of the defilements is the future non-arising of the defilements due to the removal of the residues of the defilements.

original: las gang zhe na /
analyzed: las gang zhe na /
translated: What is action?

original: sems pa'i las dang bsams pa'i las te /
analyzed: sems pa'i las dang bsams pa'i las te /
translated: It is intention and the action following intention.

original: las kyi mtshan nyid mdor bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: las kyi mtshan nyid mdor bsdus pa'o //
translated: This is the definition of action in brief.

original: yang las rnam pa lnga ste /
analyzed: yang las rnam pa lnga ste /
translated: Moreover, action is of five kinds:

original: dmigs pa'i las dang / byed pa'i las dang / rtsol ba'i las dang / bsgyur ba'i las dang / 'thob pa'i las so //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i las dang / byed pa'i las dang / rtsol ba'i las dang / bsgyur ba'i las dang / 'thob pa'i las so //
translated: action as designation, action as preparation, action as intention, action as transformation, and action as acquisition.

original: skabs 'dir phal cher rtsol ba'i las su 'dod do //
analyzed: skabs 'dir phal cher rtsol ba'i las su 'dod do //
translated: In this context, action is considered to be for the most part action as preparation.

original: sems pa'i las gang zhe na /
analyzed: sems pa'i las gang zhe na /
translated: What is action as intention?

original: sems mngon par 'du byed pa yid kyi las te /
analyzed: sems mngon par 'du byed pa yid kyi las te /
translated: It is mental action consisting of the volition of the mind.

original: bsod nams dang / bsod nams ma yin pa dang mi g-yo ba'o //
analyzed: bsod nams dang / bsod nams ma yin pa dang mi g-yo ba'o //
translated: It is meritorious, demeritorious, and immovable.

original: bsams pa'i las gang zhe na /üîΩlus kyi las dang / ngag gi las dang yid kyi las so //
analyzed: bsams pa'i las gang zhe na / lus kyi las dang / ngag gi las dang yid kyi las so //
translated: What is action as the action following intention?üîΩIt is bodily action and vocal action.

original: lus kyi las dang / ngag gi las dang / yid kyi las de yang dge ba dang mi dge ba'o //
analyzed: lus kyi las dang / ngag gi las dang / yid kyi las de yang dge ba dang mi dge ba'o //
translated: Bodily and vocal action are virtuous or non-virtuous.

original: @85b mi dge ba ni mi dge ba'i las kyi lam bcu ste /
analyzed: @85b mi dge ba ni mi dge ba'i las kyi lam bcu ste /
translated: Nonvirtue is the ten paths of nonvirtuous action.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are

original: srog gcod pa dang / ma byin par len pa dang / 'dod pa la log par g-yem pa dang / brdzun du smra ba dang / phra ma dang / tshig rtsub po dang / tshig kyal ba dang / brnab sems dang / gnod sems dang /üîΩlog par lta ba'o //
analyzed: srog gcod pa dang / ma byin par len pa dang / 'dod pa la log par g-yem pa dang / brdzun du smra ba dang / phra ma dang / tshig rtsub po dang / tshig kyal ba dang / brnab sems dang / gnod sems dang / log par lta ba'o //
translated: killing, stealing, sexual misconduct, lying, slander, harsh speech, idle talk, covetousness, malice, and wrong views.

original: dge ba ni dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam rnams te /
analyzed: dge ba ni dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam rnams te /
translated: Virtue is the ten paths of virtuous action.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are

original: srog gcod pa spong ba nas tshig kyal ba'i bar du spong ba dang / brnab sems med pa dang / gnod sems med pa dang / yang dag par lta ba'o //
analyzed: srog gcod pa spong ba nas tshig kyal ba'i bar du spong ba dang / brnab sems med pa dang / gnod sems med pa dang / yang dag par lta ba'o //
translated: refraining from killing, refraining from stealing, refraining from sexual misconduct, refraining from lying, refraining from slander, refraining from harsh speech, refraining from idle talk, noncovetousness, nonmalice, and right views.

original: srog gcod pa la sogs pa rnams kyi mtshan nyid ni gzhi dang / bsam pa dang / sbyor ba dang / nyon mongs pa dang / zin par byas pas kyang rig par bya'o //
analyzed: srog gcod pa la sogs pa rnams kyi mtshan nyid ni gzhi dang / bsam pa dang / sbyor ba dang / nyon mongs pa dang / zin par byas pas kyang rig par bya'o //
translated: The characteristics of killing and so on should be understood in terms of basis, intention, performance, affliction, and completion.

original: sems pa las gyur pa'i las zhes gang 'byung ba la sems pa las gyur ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: sems pa las gyur pa'i las zhes gang 'byung ba la sems pa las gyur ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is karma that is intention?

original: gzhan gyis bsgo ba sems pa las gyur pa dang / gzhan gyis gsol ba btab pa sems pa las gyur pa dang / mi shes pa'i sems pa las gyur pa dang / rtsa ba la mngon par zhen pa'i sems pa las gyur pa dang / phyin ci log gi sems pa las gyur ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyis bsgo ba sems pa las gyur pa dang / gzhan gyis gsol ba btab pa sems pa las gyur pa dang / mi shes pa'i sems pa las gyur pa dang / rtsa ba la mngon par zhen pa'i sems pa las gyur pa dang / phyin ci log gi sems pa las gyur ba'o //
translated: 1) action born of the order of another, 2) action born of the request of another, 3) action born of ignorance, 4) action born of attachment to the root, 5) action born of error.

original: de la rtsa ba las mngon par zhen pa'i sems pa las gyur pa dang / phyin ci log gi sems pa las gyur pa'i las byas shing bsags pa'i rnam par smin pa ni myong bar mi 'gyur ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de la rtsa ba las mngon par zhen pa'i sems pa las gyur pa dang / phyin ci log gi sems pa las gyur pa'i las byas shing bsags pa'i rnam par smin pa ni myong bar mi 'gyur ba ma yin no //
translated: Among these, the action born of attachment to the root and the action born of error are not without retribution.

original: las kyi byed pa ni kun tu spyod pa'o //
analyzed: las kyi byed pa ni kun tu spyod pa'o //
translated: The performance of action is the practice.

original: bsags pa ni bag chags 'phel ba'o //
analyzed: bsags pa ni bag chags 'phel ba'o //
translated: The accumulation of action is the increase of the traces.

original: myong bar nges pa'i las zhes gang 'byung ba las nges pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: myong bar nges pa'i las zhes gang 'byung ba las nges pa gang zhe na /
translated: As for the action whose retribution is certain, what is the certainty of action?

original: las byed par nges pa dang / rnam par smin pa myong bar nges pa dang dus nges pa'o //
analyzed: las byed par nges pa dang / rnam par smin pa myong bar nges pa dang dus nges pa'o //
translated: The certainty of action is the certainty of performance, the certainty of retribution, and the certainty of time.

original: de la mi dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam rnams kyi rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu ni ngan song rnams su'o //
analyzed: de la mi dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam rnams kyi rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu ni ngan song rnams su'o //
translated: The ripened result of the ten unwholesome courses of action is in the lower realms.

original: rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu ni so so dang mthun par mi'i lus dang / yongs su gzungs ba mi 'byor ba'o //
analyzed: rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu ni so so dang mthun par mi'i lus dang / yongs su gzungs ba mi 'byor ba'o //
translated: The result corresponding to the cause is, in accordance with each, a human body and a lack of complete enjoyment.

original: bdag po'i 'bras bu ni so so dang mthun pa nyid du phyi'i dngos po mi 'byor ba'o //
analyzed: bdag po'i 'bras bu ni so so dang mthun pa nyid du phyi'i dngos po mi 'byor ba'o //
translated: The dominant result is, in accordance with each, a lack of complete enjoyment of external things.

original: de yang mdo las ji skad du dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam rnams kyi rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu ni lha dang mi rnams kyi nang du'o //
analyzed: de yang mdo las ji skad du dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam rnams kyi rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu ni lha dang mi rnams kyi nang du'o //
translated: Moreover, as it says in the sutra, ‚ÄúThe ripened result of the ten wholesome courses of action is among gods and humans.

original: rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu ni de dag nyid du so so dang mthun par lus dang yongs su gzung ba phun sum tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu ni de dag nyid du so so dang mthun par lus dang yongs su gzung ba phun sum tshogs pa'o //
translated: The result corresponding to the cause is, in accordance with each, the perfection of body and possessions.

original: @86a * // bdag po'i 'bras bu ni de dag nyid du so so dang mthun pa'i phyi'i dngos po phun sum tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: @86a * // bdag po'i 'bras bu ni de dag nyid du so so dang mthun pa'i phyi'i dngos po phun sum tshogs pa'o //
translated: The dominant result is, in accordance with each, the perfection of external things.‚Äù

original: dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las kyis ni bde 'gro dang ngan 'gror skye ba 'phen pa dang yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'i las su rig par bya'o //
analyzed: dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las kyis ni bde 'gro dang ngan 'gror skye ba 'phen pa dang yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'i las su rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that virtuous and nonvirtuous actions are the actions that project and complete rebirth in good and bad destinies.

original: 'phen pa ni gang gis rnam par smin pa 'phen pa'o //
analyzed: 'phen pa ni gang gis rnam par smin pa 'phen pa'o //
translated: The projecting action is that by which the result is projected.

original: yongs su rdzogs par byed pa ni gang gis skyes pa na 'dod pa dang mi 'dod pa myong ba'o //
analyzed: yongs su rdzogs par byed pa ni gang gis skyes pa na 'dod pa dang mi 'dod pa myong ba'o //
translated: The completing action is that by which the result is experienced when born.

original: las gcig gis lus gcig 'phen par byed pa'i las kyang yod /üîΩlas gcig gis lus du ma 'phen par byed pa'i las kyang yod /üîΩlas du mas lus gcig 'phen pa'i las kyang yod /
analyzed: las gcig gis lus gcig 'phen par byed pa'i las kyang yod / las gcig gis lus du ma 'phen par byed pa'i las kyang yod / las du mas lus gcig 'phen pa'i las kyang yod /
translated: There is an action by which a single body is projected by a single action.üîΩThere is an action by which many bodies are projected by a single action.üîΩThere is an action by which a single body is projected by many actions.

original: las du mas lus du ma 'phen pa'i las kyang yod do //
analyzed: las du mas lus du ma 'phen pa'i las kyang yod do //
translated: There is an action by which many bodies are projected by many actions.

original: las mang po dang po dang ldan pa'i sems can ji ltar rim gyis rnam par smin pa myong bar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: las mang po dang po dang ldan pa'i sems can ji ltar rim gyis rnam par smin pa myong bar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How do sentient beings who possess many actions experience the results in order?

original: de la gang shin tu lci bar gyur pa de thog mar rnam par smin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la gang shin tu lci bar gyur pa de thog mar rnam par smin par 'gyur ro //
translated: Whatever is heaviest ripens first.

original: yang na 'chi ba'i dus na gang mngon du gyur pa'o //
analyzed: yang na 'chi ba'i dus na gang mngon du gyur pa'o //
translated: Or else, it is that which is manifested at the moment of death.

original: yang na gang goms par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: yang na gang goms par gyur pa'o //
translated: Or else, it is that to which one has habitually dedicated oneself.

original: yang na gang thog mar spyad pa de thog ma nyid du rnam par smin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang na gang thog mar spyad pa de thog ma nyid du rnam par smin par 'gyur ro //
translated: Or else, it is that which is first in order of the ripening of its effects.

original: bsod nams kyi las dang / bsod nams ma yin pa'i las dang / mi g-yo ba'i las zhes gang 'byung ba la /
analyzed: bsod nams kyi las dang / bsod nams ma yin pa'i las dang / mi g-yo ba'i las zhes gang 'byung ba la /
translated: What is meritorious action? What is demeritorious action? What is immovable action?

original: bsod nams gang zhe na /
analyzed: bsod nams gang zhe na /
translated: What is meritorious action?

original: gang 'dod pa dang rab tu ldan pa'i dge ba'o //
analyzed: gang 'dod pa dang rab tu ldan pa'i dge ba'o //
translated: It is good action associated with the realm of desire.

original: bsod nams ma yin pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: bsod nams ma yin pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is demeritorious action?

original: gang mi dge ba'o //
analyzed: gang mi dge ba'o //
translated: It is bad action.

original: mi g-yo ba'i las gang zhe na /
analyzed: mi g-yo ba'i las gang zhe na /
translated: What is immovable action?

original: gang gzugs dang gzugs med pa dang rab tu ldan pa'i dge ba'o //
analyzed: gang gzugs dang gzugs med pa dang rab tu ldan pa'i dge ba'o //
translated: It is good action associated with the realms of form and of the formless.

original: ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis bsod nams dang bsod nams ma yin pa dang / mi g-yo ba'i 'du byed rnams so zhes gang gsungs pa de la /
analyzed: ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis bsod nams dang bsod nams ma yin pa dang / mi g-yo ba'i 'du byed rnams so zhes gang gsungs pa de la /
translated: It is said in the Sutra: ‚ÄúConditioned by ignorance, there are the meritorious, demeritorious and immovable formations.‚ÄùüîΩWhat is the meaning of this?

original: ji ltar na bsod nams dang bsod nams ma yin pa dang / mi g-yo ba'i 'du byed rnams ma rig pa'i rkyen las byung ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na bsod nams dang bsod nams ma yin pa dang / mi g-yo ba'i 'du byed rnams ma rig pa'i rkyen las byung ba yin zhe na /
translated: How are meritorious, non-meritorious, and unshakable formations produced from the condition of ignorance?

original: rmongs pa ni gnyis te /
analyzed: rmongs pa ni gnyis te /
translated: There are two kinds of delusion:

original: 'bras bu rnams par smin pa la rmongs pa dang / de kho na'i don la rmongs pa'o //üîΩ'bras bu rnams par smin pa la rmongs pa'i ni mi dge ba'i 'du byed rnams 'byung ngo //
analyzed: 'bras bu rnams par smin pa la rmongs pa dang / de kho na'i don la rmongs pa'o // 'bras bu rnams par smin pa la rmongs pa'i ni mi dge ba'i 'du byed rnams 'byung ngo //
translated: delusion about the ripening of results and delusion about the meaning of reality.üîΩMeritorious formations are produced from delusion about the ripening of results.

original: de kho na'i don la rmongs pa'i ni bsod nams dang mi g-yo ba rnams so //
analyzed: de kho na'i don la rmongs pa'i ni bsod nams dang mi g-yo ba rnams so //
translated: Shakable and unshakable formations are produced from delusion about the meaning of reality.

original: srog gcod pa la ni chags pa dang zhe sdang dang gti mug gis sbyor te /
analyzed: srog gcod pa la ni chags pa dang zhe sdang dang gti mug gis sbyor te /
translated: One engages in killing through desire, hatred, and delusion.

original: zhes sdang gis mthar phyin par byed do //
analyzed: zhes sdang gis mthar phyin par byed do //
translated: One completes it through hatred.

original: srog gcod pa la ji ltar bar ngag rtsub po dang gnod sems la yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: srog gcod pa la ji ltar bar ngag rtsub po dang gnod sems la yang de bzhin no //
translated: As with killing, so it is with harsh speech and malice.

original: ma byin par len pa la ni @86b 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug gis sbyor te /
analyzed: ma byin par len pa la ni @86b 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug gis sbyor te /
translated: One engages in taking what is not given through desire, hatred, and delusion.

original: chags pas mthar phyin par byed do //
analyzed: chags pas mthar phyin par byed do //
translated: One completes it through desire.

original: ma byin par len pa la ji lta bar 'dod pa la log par g-yem pa dang / brnab sems la yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: ma byin par len pa la ji lta bar 'dod pa la log par g-yem pa dang / brnab sems la yang de bzhin no //
translated: Sexual misconduct, covetousness and malice are accomplished by the same causes as stealing.

original: brdzun du smra ba la ni chags pa dang zhes sdang dang gti mug gis sbyor te /
analyzed: brdzun du smra ba la ni chags pa dang zhes sdang dang gti mug gis sbyor te /
translated: Lying is accomplished by attachment, hatred or delusion.

original: gsum po dag las gang yang rung bas mthar phyin par byed do //
analyzed: gsum po dag las gang yang rung bas mthar phyin par byed do //
translated: It is accomplished by any of the three, attachment, etc.

original: brdzun du smra ba la ji lta bar phra ma dang tshig kyal pa la yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: brdzun du smra ba la ji lta bar phra ma dang tshig kyal pa la yang de bzhin no //
translated: Slander and idle speech are accomplished by the same causes as lying.

original: log par lta ba la ni chags pa dang zhe sdang dang gti mug gis sbyor te /
analyzed: log par lta ba la ni chags pa dang zhe sdang dang gti mug gis sbyor te /
translated: Wrong views are accomplished by attachment, hatred or delusion.

original: gti mug gis mthar phyin par byed do //üîΩlas thun mong pa zhes kyang 'byung /
analyzed: gti mug gis mthar phyin par byed do // las thun mong pa zhes kyang 'byung /
translated: They are accomplished by delusion.üîΩKarma is also said to be common.

original: las thun mong ma yin pa zhes kyang 'byung /
analyzed: las thun mong ma yin pa zhes kyang 'byung /
translated: It is also said to be uncommon.

original: stobs dang ldan pa zhes kyang 'byung /
analyzed: stobs dang ldan pa zhes kyang 'byung /
translated: It is also said to be powerful.

original: mthu chung ba zhes kyang 'byung ba la /
analyzed: mthu chung ba zhes kyang 'byung ba la /
translated: It is also said to be weak.

original: thun mong pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: thun mong pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is common karma?

original: gang snod kyi 'jig rten rnams par 'byed pa'o //
analyzed: gang snod kyi 'jig rten rnams par 'byed pa'o //
translated: It is that which distinguishes the world of the environment.

original: thun mong ma yin pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: thun mong ma yin pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is uncommon karma?

original: gang sems can gyi 'jig rten rnam par 'byed pa'o //
analyzed: gang sems can gyi 'jig rten rnam par 'byed pa'o //
translated: It is the world of sentient beings.

original: yang gang gis sems can rnams kyi phan tshun gyi dbang gis byung ba zhes brjod pa sems can rnams kyi phan tshun gyi dbang gis 'byung ba'i las kyang yod de /
analyzed: yang gang gis sems can rnams kyi phan tshun gyi dbang gis byung ba zhes brjod pa sems can rnams kyi phan tshun gyi dbang gis 'byung ba'i las kyang yod de /
translated: There is also action that arises through the power of other sentient beings.

original: 'di ltar gang sems can gzhan rnams dang phan tshun du lta ba la sogs pas nye bar spyod par mi 'gyur ba'i sems can de ni mong pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar gang sems can gzhan rnams dang phan tshun du lta ba la sogs pas nye bar spyod par mi 'gyur ba'i sems can de ni mong pa ma yin no //
translated: For, if a sentient being does not have the power to see, etc., other sentient beings, then that sentient being would not exist.

original: stobs dang ldan pa'i las gang zhe na /
analyzed: stobs dang ldan pa'i las gang zhe na /
translated: What is powerful action?

original: gnyen po'i stobs can gyi gang zag gi sems pa las gyur pa'i las mi dge ba gang yin pa de ni gnyen po'i stobs bskyed pas /üîΩgang sems can dmyal ba myong bar 'gyur ba de mthong ba'i chos la myong bar 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: gnyen po'i stobs can gyi gang zag gi sems pa las gyur pa'i las mi dge ba gang yin pa de ni gnyen po'i stobs bskyed pas / gang sems can dmyal ba myong bar 'gyur ba de mthong ba'i chos la myong bar 'gyur ba'am /
translated: It is action that arises from the volition of a person who has the power of antidote.üîΩIt is action that should be experienced in hell, but which is experienced in this life because of the power of the antidote.

original: gang mthong ba'i chos la myong bar 'gyur ba de myong bar mi 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: gang mthong ba'i chos la myong bar 'gyur ba de myong bar mi 'gyur ba ste /
translated: Or it is action that should be experienced in this life, but which is not experienced because of the power of the antidote.

original: de ltar na gnyen po las byung ba'i las dang sems pa las gyur ba'i dge ba'i las thams cad kyang stobs dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar na gnyen po las byung ba'i las dang sems pa las gyur ba'i dge ba'i las thams cad kyang stobs dang ldan pa'o //
translated: Thus, all virtuous actions that arise from antidotes and are intentional are powerful.

original: 'di las dgongs nas bcom ldan 'das kyis 'phags pa nyan thos sems shin tu bsgoms pa tshad med pas rgya che ba la /
analyzed: 'di las dgongs nas bcom ldan 'das kyis 'phags pa nyan thos sems shin tu bsgoms pa tshad med pas rgya che ba la /
translated: With this in mind, the Blessed One said to the noble disciple who has cultivated his mind immeasurably and extensively:

original: gang tshad du byas pa'i las nges de khrid par mi byed do //
analyzed: gang tshad du byas pa'i las nges de khrid par mi byed do //
translated: ‚ÄúWhatever action you have done that is measured, I will not lead you to it.

original: de la de dag gnas par mi bya'o //
analyzed: de la de dag gnas par mi bya'o //
translated: You should not dwell on it.

original: des de bgrang bar mi 'gyur ro zhes gsungs so //üîΩgnyen po'i mthu chung ba'i gang zag gi sems pa las gyur pa'i las mi dge ba gang yin pa de dang / gang yang sems pa las gyur pa'i las rnam par smin @87a * //
analyzed: des de bgrang bar mi 'gyur ro zhes gsungs so // gnyen po'i mthu chung ba'i gang zag gi sems pa las gyur pa'i las mi dge ba gang yin pa de dang / gang yang sems pa las gyur pa'i las rnam par smin @87a * //
translated: You will not be counted among them.‚Äù

original: par nges pa de ma spangs ba dang / yongs su ma shes pa de ni stobs dang ldan pa yin te /
analyzed: par nges pa de ma spangs ba dang / yongs su ma shes pa de ni stobs dang ldan pa yin te /
translated: Any nonvirtuous action that is intentional by a person whose antidotes are weak, and any action that is intentional and certain to ripen, that has not been abandoned and not fully understood, is powerful.

original: 'di ni 'dir dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni 'dir dgongs pa'o //
translated: This is the intended meaning here.

original: yang 'dod pa dang rab tu ldan pa'i mi dge ba gang yin pa dang / gang sngon goms par byas pa dang / gnas la gnas pa dang / yongs su mya ngan las mi 'da' ba'i chos can rnams kyi bsgrub tu med pa gang yin pa da ni rang bzhin gyis stobs dang ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: yang 'dod pa dang rab tu ldan pa'i mi dge ba gang yin pa dang / gang sngon goms par byas pa dang / gnas la gnas pa dang / yongs su mya ngan las mi 'da' ba'i chos can rnams kyi bsgrub tu med pa gang yin pa da ni rang bzhin gyis stobs dang ldan pa yin no //
translated: Moreover, unwholesome action associated with the realm of desire, that which is habitually repeated, that which is committed in relation to a field of qualities, that which is committed by one who is not subject to change, and that which is committed by one who is not subject to complete nirvana is powerful by nature.

original: zhing dang sems kyi mngon par 'du byed pas kyang stobs dang ldan pa'i las su rig par bya'o //
analyzed: zhing dang sems kyi mngon par 'du byed pas kyang stobs dang ldan pa'i las su rig par bya'o //
translated: Action is also powerful by reason of the field and the volition.

original: yang rnam pa dgus stobs dang ldan pa'i las su rig par bya ste /
analyzed: yang rnam pa dgus stobs dang ldan pa'i las su rig par bya ste /
translated: Action is also powerful by reason of nine causes:

original: zhing dang / dngos po dang / ngo bo nyid dang / gzhi bo dang / yid la byed pa dang / bsam pa dang / grogs dang / lan mang du byed pa dang / skye bo mang pos kyang stobs dang ldan pa ste /
analyzed: zhing dang / dngos po dang / ngo bo nyid dang / gzhi bo dang / yid la byed pa dang / bsam pa dang / grogs dang / lan mang du byed pa dang / skye bo mang pos kyang stobs dang ldan pa ste /
translated: field, object, nature, basis, attention, intention, series, number, and person.

original: 'di las bzlog pa ni stobs dang mi ldan pa'i las so //
analyzed: 'di las bzlog pa ni stobs dang mi ldan pa'i las so //
translated: The opposite of this is weak action.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis su zhig 'di skad du skyes bu gang zag 'di ji lta ji ltar las byed cing sogs pa de lta de ltar rnam par smin pa myong bar 'gyur na /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis su zhig 'di skad du skyes bu gang zag 'di ji lta ji ltar las byed cing sogs pa de lta de ltar rnam par smin pa myong bar 'gyur na /
translated: The BhagavƒÅn said, ‚ÄúSomeone might say, ‚ÄòIf this person performs and accumulates karma in such and such a way, he will experience the ripening in such and such a way.üîΩIf that is so, then it would not be possible to abide in pure conduct and there would be no opportunity for the complete exhaustion of suffering and the removal of suffering.‚Äô

original: de lta na tshangs par spyod par gnas par mi 'gyur zhing yang dag par sdug bsngal zad pa dang / sdug bsngal mthar dbyung ba'i skabs kyang mi snang ngo zhes zer ba dang / yang su zhig 'di skad du skyes bu gang zag 'di ji lta ji ltar myong bar 'gyur ba'i las byed cing sogs pa de lta de ltar rnam par smin pa myong bar 'gyur na /
analyzed: de lta na tshangs par spyod par gnas par mi 'gyur zhing yang dag par sdug bsngal zad pa dang / sdug bsngal mthar dbyung ba'i skabs kyang mi snang ngo zhes zer ba dang / yang su zhig 'di skad du skyes bu gang zag 'di ji lta ji ltar myong bar 'gyur ba'i las byed cing sogs pa de lta de ltar rnam par smin pa myong bar 'gyur na /
translated: Someone else might say, ‚ÄòIf this person performs and accumulates karma in such and such a way, he will experience the ripening in such and such a way.

original: de lta na ni tshangs par spyod pas gnas par 'gyur zhing yang dag par sdug bsngal zad par 'gyur pa dang / sdug bsngal mthar dbyung ba'i skabs kyang snang ngo /üîΩzhes zer zhes /
analyzed: de lta na ni tshangs par spyod pas gnas par 'gyur zhing yang dag par sdug bsngal zad par 'gyur pa dang / sdug bsngal mthar dbyung ba'i skabs kyang snang ngo /üîΩzhes zer zhes /
translated: If that is so, then it would be possible to abide in pure conduct and there would be an opportunity for the complete exhaustion of suffering and the removal of suffering.‚Äô

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis gang gsungs pa de la dgongs pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis gang gsungs pa de la dgongs pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the intention of the Blessed One in what he has said?

original: 'dir ni bcom ldan 'das kyis bde ba dang ldan pa'i las kyi rnam par smin pa bde ba dang ldan pa bkag go //
analyzed: 'dir ni bcom ldan 'das kyis bde ba dang ldan pa'i las kyi rnam par smin pa bde ba dang ldan pa bkag go //
translated: Here the Blessed One has refuted the ripening of karma that is associated with pleasure and is associated with pleasure.

original: sdug bsngal dang ldan pa'i sdug bsngal dang ldan pa dang / sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa dang ldan pa'i sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa dang ldan pa yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: sdug bsngal dang ldan pa'i sdug bsngal dang ldan pa dang / sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa dang ldan pa'i sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa dang ldan pa yang de bzhin no //
translated: The same should be understood for the ripening of karma that is associated with pain and is associated with pain, and that is associated with neither pleasure nor pain and is associated with neither pleasure nor pain.

original: yang bde ba dang ldan zhing bde ba myong ba bar 'gyur ba'i rnams par smin pa bde ba ni gnang ngo //
analyzed: yang bde ba dang ldan zhing bde ba myong ba bar 'gyur ba'i rnams par smin pa bde ba ni gnang ngo //
translated: But the Blessed One has allowed the ripening of karma that is associated with pleasure and is to be experienced as pleasure.

original: sdug bsngal myong bar 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal dang / sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde @87b ba yang ma yin pa myong bar 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal yang ma yin pa bde ba yang ma yin pa dang / sdug bsngal dang ldan la bde ba myong bar 'gyur ba'i rnam par smin pa bde ba ni gnang ngo //
analyzed: sdug bsngal myong bar 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal dang / sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde @87b ba yang ma yin pa myong bar 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal yang ma yin pa bde ba yang ma yin pa dang / sdug bsngal dang ldan la bde ba myong bar 'gyur ba'i rnam par smin pa bde ba ni gnang ngo //
translated: The suffering that is experienced as suffering, the suffering that is experienced as neither suffering nor pleasure, and the suffering that is associated with pleasure, which is the pleasant ripening that is experienced as suffering.üîΩ

original: sdug bsngal myong bar 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal dang / sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa myong bar 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa dang / sdug bsngal yang ma yin pa bde ba yang ma yin pa dang ldan la bde ba myong bar 'gyur ba'i rnam par smin pa bde ba ni gnang ngo //
analyzed: sdug bsngal myong bar 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal dang / sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa myong bar 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa dang / sdug bsngal yang ma yin pa bde ba yang ma yin pa dang ldan la bde ba myong bar 'gyur ba'i rnam par smin pa bde ba ni gnang ngo //

analyzed: so so'i skye bo'i tshul khrims dang / dbang po'i sgo bsdams pa dang / zas kyi tshod shes pa dang / nam gyi cha stod dang / nam gyi chad smad la mi nyal bar rnal 'byor la brtson pa dang / shes bzhin du gnas par mngon par dga' ba'o //

translated: What is the mundane path?

original: 'jig rten pa'i bsam gtan dang po dang gnyis pa dang / gsum pa dang / bsam gtan bzhi pa dang / nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched dang / rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched dang / ci yang med pa'i skye mched dang / 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched de /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i bsam gtan dang po dang gnyis pa dang / gsum pa dang / bsam gtan bzhi pa dang / nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched dang / rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched dang / ci yang med pa'i skye mched dang / 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched de /
translated: The mundane concentrations are the first, second, third, and fourth concentrations, the sphere of infinite space, the sphere of infinite consciousness, the sphere of nothingness, and the sphere of neither perception nor non-perception.

original: bsam gtan dang / gzugs med pa de dag kyang kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba dang / rnam par gzhag pa dang / rnam par dag pas rig par bya'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan dang / gzugs med pa de dag kyang kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba dang / rnam par gzhag pa dang / rnam par dag pas rig par bya'o //
translated: These concentrations and formless states should be understood in terms of their defilement, purification, classification, and complete purity.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pas ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pas ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: How are they defiled?

original: lung du ma bstan pa'i rtsa ba bzhi po /
analyzed: lung du ma bstan pa'i rtsa ba bzhi po /
translated: The four indeterminate roots are

original: sred pa dang / lta ba dang / nga rgyal dang / ma rig pa'o //
analyzed: sred pa dang / lta ba dang / nga rgyal dang / ma rig pa'o //
translated: craving, view, pride, and ignorance.

original: sred pas ni ro myong ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pas kun nas nyon mongs so //
analyzed: sred pas ni ro myong ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pas kun nas nyon mongs so //
translated: Craving defiles them by the defilement of relishing.

original: lta bas ni lta ba shas ches ba'i bsam gtan pa nyid kyis kun nas nyon mongs so //
analyzed: lta bas ni lta ba shas ches ba'i bsam gtan pa nyid kyis kun nas nyon mongs so //
translated: View defiles them by the meditative development of the view that one‚Äôs concentration is supreme.

original: nga rgyal gyis ni nga rgyal shas che ba'i bsam gtan pa nyid kyis kun nas nyon mongs so //
analyzed: nga rgyal gyis ni nga rgyal shas che ba'i bsam gtan pa nyid kyis kun nas nyon mongs so //
translated: The defilement of pride is due to the predominance of pride in the meditation of those who are proud.

original: ma rig pas ni the tshom shas che ba'i bsam gtan pa nyid kyis kun nas nyon mongs so //
analyzed: ma rig pas ni the tshom shas che ba'i bsam gtan pa nyid kyis kun nas nyon mongs so //
translated: The defilement of ignorance is due to the predominance of doubt in the meditation of those who are ignorant.

original: de ltar sems kun nas nyon mongs pa dag la gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de ltar sems kun nas nyon mongs pa dag la gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams 'byung ngo //
translated: Thus, the defilements of the mind give rise to the major and minor defilements of the realms of form and the formless.

original: rnam par byang bas ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: rnam par byang bas ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is purification?

original: dag pa pa'i bsam gtan dang / gzugs med pa rnams kyang dge ba'i phyir rnam par byang ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dag pa pa'i bsam gtan dang / gzugs med pa rnams kyang dge ba'i phyir rnam par byang ba zhes bya'o //
translated: The pure meditations and formless states are called purification because they are wholesome.

original: rnam par gzhag pas ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: rnam par gzhag pas ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is definition?

original: yan lag rnam par gzhag pa dang / snyoms par 'jug pa rnam par gzhag pa dang / tshad rnam par gzhag pa dang / ming du gdags pa rnams par gzhag pas so //
analyzed: yan lag rnam par gzhag pa dang / snyoms par 'jug pa rnam par gzhag pa dang / tshad rnam par gzhag pa dang / ming du gdags pa rnams par gzhag pas so //
translated: It is definition by the definition of the members, the definition of the attainments, the definition of the categories and the definition of the designations.

original: yan lag rnam par gzhag pas ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: yan lag rnam par gzhag pas ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is the definition of the members?

original: bsam gtan dang po la yan lag lnga ste /
analyzed: bsam gtan dang po la yan lag lnga ste /
translated: The first absorption has five branches.

original: yan lag lnga @94b ni rtog pa dang / dpyod pa dang / dga' ba dang / bde ba dang / sems rtse gcig pa nyid do //
analyzed: yan lag lnga @94b ni rtog pa dang / dpyod pa dang / dga' ba dang / bde ba dang / sems rtse gcig pa nyid do //
translated: The five branches are investigation, analysis, joy, pleasure, and a single area of mind.

original: bsam gtan gnyis pa la yan lag bzhi ste /
analyzed: bsam gtan gnyis pa la yan lag bzhi ste /
translated: The second absorption has four branches.

original: yan lag bzhi ni nang rab tu dang ba dang / dga' ba dang / bde ba dang / sems rtse gcig pa nyid do //
analyzed: yan lag bzhi ni nang rab tu dang ba dang / dga' ba dang / bde ba dang / sems rtse gcig pa nyid do //
translated: The four branches are internal clarity, joy, pleasure, and a single area of mind.

original: bsam gtan gsum pa la yan lag lnga ste ;
analyzed: bsam gtan gsum pa la yan lag lnga ste ;
translated: The third absorption has five branches.

original: yal lag lnga ni btang snyoms dang / dran pa dang / shes bzhin dang / bde ba dang / sems rtse gcig pa nyid do //
analyzed: yal lag lnga ni btang snyoms dang / dran pa dang / shes bzhin dang / bde ba dang / sems rtse gcig pa nyid do //
translated: The five branches are equanimity, mindfulness, alertness, pleasure, and a single area of mind.

original: bsam gtan bzhi pa la yan lag bzhi ste /
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi pa la yan lag bzhi ste /
translated: The fourth absorption has four branches.

original: yan lag bzhi ni btang snyoms yongs su dag pa dang / dran pa yongs su dag pa dang / sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba dang / sems rtse gcig pa nyid do //
analyzed: yan lag bzhi ni btang snyoms yongs su dag pa dang / dran pa yongs su dag pa dang / sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba dang / sems rtse gcig pa nyid do //
translated: The four branches are pure equanimity, pure mindfulness, a feeling that is neither pleasure nor pain, and a single area of mind.

original: gnyen po'i yan lag dang / phan yon gyi yan lag dang de gnyi ga'i gnas kyi rang bzhin gyi yan lag gi phyir ro //
analyzed: gnyen po'i yan lag dang / phan yon gyi yan lag dang de gnyi ga'i gnas kyi rang bzhin gyi yan lag gi phyir ro //
translated: because they are the branches of application, the branches of benefit, and the branches of nature which is the basis of both of those.

original: gzugs med pa rnams na ni zhi gnas su ro gcig pa nyid kyi phyir yan lag rnam par gzhag pa med do ;
analyzed: gzugs med pa rnams na ni zhi gnas su ro gcig pa nyid kyi phyir yan lag rnam par gzhag pa med do ;
translated: In the formless realms, there is no establishment of branches because calm abiding is of one taste.

original: / snyoms par 'jug pa rnam par gzhag pas ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: / snyoms par 'jug pa rnam par gzhag pas ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: How so by the establishment of meditative attainment?

original: yid la byed pa bdun gyis bsam gtan dang po la snyoms par 'jug ste /
analyzed: yid la byed pa bdun gyis bsam gtan dang po la snyoms par 'jug ste /
translated: One enters meditative attainment in the first meditative stabilization through seven attentions:

original: 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched kyi bar du yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched kyi bar du yang de bzhin no //
translated: up to the sphere of neither perception nor non-perception.

original: yid la byed pa bdun gang zhe na /
analyzed: yid la byed pa bdun gang zhe na /
translated: What are the seven attentions?

original: mtshan nyid rab tu rig pa'i yid la byed pa dang / mos pa las byung ba dang / rab tu dben pa las byung ba dang / dga' ba sdud pa dang / dpyod pa dang / sbyor ba'i mtha' dang / sbyor ba'i mtha'i 'bras bu yid la byed pa'o //
analyzed: mtshan nyid rab tu rig pa'i yid la byed pa dang / mos pa las byung ba dang / rab tu dben pa las byung ba dang / dga' ba sdud pa dang / dpyod pa dang / sbyor ba'i mtha' dang / sbyor ba'i mtha'i 'bras bu yid la byed pa'o //
translated: Attention that is the knowledge of characteristics, attention that arises from belief, attention that arises from isolation, attention that is the gathering of joy, attention that is investigation, attention that is the culmination of application, and attention that is the result of the culmination of application.

original: tshad rnam par gzhag pas ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: tshad rnam par gzhag pas ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: How so by the establishment of measure?

original: bsam gtan dang po la chung ngur yongs su bsgoms pa dang / 'bring dang chen por yongs su bsgoms pa'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan dang po la chung ngur yongs su bsgoms pa dang / 'bring dang chen por yongs su bsgoms pa'o //
translated: The first meditation is cultivated in a weak, medium, and strong way.

original: bsam gtan dang po la ji lta bar bsam gtan lhag ma rnams dang / gzugs med pa rnams kyang de bzhin no //
analyzed: bsam gtan dang po la ji lta bar bsam gtan lhag ma rnams dang / gzugs med pa rnams kyang de bzhin no //
translated: The same holds for the other meditations and the formless meditative attainments.

original: bsam gtan dang po la chung ngu dang / 'bring dang cher yongs su bsgoms pa'i 'bras bu ni bsam gtan dang po'i skye ba gsum mo ;üîΩ/ bsam gtan dang po la ji lta bar bsam gtan lhag ma rnams kyi yang de bzhin te /
analyzed: bsam gtan dang po la chung ngu dang / 'bring dang cher yongs su bsgoms pa'i 'bras bu ni bsam gtan dang po'i skye ba gsum mo ; / bsam gtan dang po la ji lta bar bsam gtan lhag ma rnams kyi yang de bzhin te /
translated: The three births in the first meditation are the effect of the first meditation cultivated in a weak, medium, and strong way.

original: bsam gtan gyi skye ba rnam pa gsum gsum mo //
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi skye ba rnam pa gsum gsum mo //
translated: The same holds for the other meditations, each having three births.

original: gzugs med pa na ni gnas gzhan med pa'i phyir skye ba tha dad pa yang med do //üîΩde na chung ngu dang / 'bring dang / chen por yongs su bsgoms pas @95a * //
analyzed: gzugs med pa na ni gnas gzhan med pa'i phyir skye ba tha dad pa yang med do // de na chung ngu dang / 'bring dang / chen por yongs su bsgoms pas @95a * //
translated: In the formless realms, there are no different places, and so there are no different births.

original: gzugs med pa rnams su skye ba mthon po dang / dma' ba dang / ngan pa dang / bzang por mngon no //
analyzed: gzugs med pa rnams su skye ba mthon po dang / dma' ba dang / ngan pa dang / bzang por mngon no //
translated: There, birth in the formless realms is distinguished as high or low, bad or good, by the cultivation of the formless meditative attainments in a weak, medium, or strong way.

original: ming du gdags pa rnam par gzhag pas ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: ming du gdags pa rnam par gzhag pas ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: How is it determined by the establishment of names?

original: bsam gtan dang pos bsdus pa'i ting nge 'dzin ji snyed la /
analyzed: bsam gtan dang pos bsdus pa'i ting nge 'dzin ji snyed la /
translated: The Buddhas and bodhisattvas enter into as many samadhis as are included in the first meditation,

original: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams snyoms par 'jug pa de dag gi ming yang nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams kyis mi shes so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams snyoms par 'jug pa de dag gi ming yang nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams kyis mi shes so //
translated: and the names of those samadhis are not known to the sravakas and pratyekabuddhas.

original: bsam gtan dang pos bsdus pa ji lta bar bsam gtan lhag ma rnams dang / gzugs med pas bsdus pa rnams kyang de bzhin te /
analyzed: bsam gtan dang pos bsdus pa ji lta bar bsam gtan lhag ma rnams dang / gzugs med pas bsdus pa rnams kyang de bzhin te /
translated: Just as with those included in the first meditation, so it is with those included in the remaining meditations and the formless [absorptions].

original: 'di ni bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa la brten nas so //
analyzed: 'di ni bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa la brten nas so //
translated: This is in dependence on the perfection of meditation.

original: rnam par dag pas ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: rnam par dag pas ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: How is it determined by purity?

original: rab kyi mtha'i cha las byung ba bsam gtan dang po nas 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched kyi bar du rnam par dag pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rab kyi mtha'i cha las byung ba bsam gtan dang po nas 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched kyi bar du rnam par dag pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The first meditation up to the sphere of neither perception nor non-perception that arises from the highest point is called pure.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam gang zhe na /
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam gang zhe na /
translated: What is the supramundane path?

original: bsgom pa'i lam la sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung ba dang ; 'gog pa dang / lam shes pa rnams te /
analyzed: bsgom pa'i lam la sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung ba dang ; 'gog pa dang / lam shes pa rnams te /
translated: The path of cultivation is the cognition of unsatisfactoriness, the cognition of the origin of unsatisfactoriness, the cognition of cessation, the cognition of the path,

original: chos shes pa dang / rjes su rtogs pa shes pa'i phyogs dang / de dag dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang / bsam gtan dang po nas ci yang med pa'i skye mched kyi bar du'o //
analyzed: chos shes pa dang / rjes su rtogs pa shes pa'i phyogs dang / de dag dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang / bsam gtan dang po nas ci yang med pa'i skye mched kyi bar du'o //
translated: the cognition of the doctrine, the subsequent cognition, the meditative attainment and the concentrations associated with them, from the first concentration to the sphere of nothingness.

original: 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched ni 'du shes kyi rgyu ba yongs su mi gsal ba'i phyir 'jig rten pa nyid de /
analyzed: 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched ni 'du shes kyi rgyu ba yongs su mi gsal ba'i phyir 'jig rten pa nyid de /
translated: The sphere of neither-ideation-nor-non-ideation is not supramundane, because ideation is not completely clear there.

original: de'i phyir mtshan ma med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir mtshan ma med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: That is why it is called the sphere of neither-ideation-nor-non-ideation.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis ji skad du /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis ji skad du /
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: ji tsam du 'du shes kyi snyoms par 'jug pa de tsam du kun shes par rtogs so zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: ji tsam du 'du shes kyi snyoms par 'jug pa de tsam du kun shes par rtogs so zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: As far as the attainment of ideation exists, there is the realization of all-knowing.

original: 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa ni 'jig rten las 'das pa ste /
analyzed: 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa ni 'jig rten las 'das pa ste /
translated: The attainment of cessation is supramundane.

original: mi rnams kyi nang du mngon par bsgrub bo //
analyzed: mi rnams kyi nang du mngon par bsgrub bo //
translated: It is actualized among human beings.

original: mi rnams kyi nang du mngon par grub nas /üîΩmi rnams kyi nang du'am /
analyzed: mi rnams kyi nang du mngon par grub nas / mi rnams kyi nang du'am /
translated: Having been actualized among humans,

original: gzugs kyi khams su mngon du byed do //
analyzed: gzugs kyi khams su mngon du byed do //
translated: it is actualized among humans or in the realm of form.

original: gzugs med pa'i khams rnams su ni 'di mngon du 'gyur ba med de /
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i khams rnams su ni 'di mngon du 'gyur ba med de /
translated: It is not actualized in the formless realm,

original: zhi ba'i rnam par thar pa'i rnam par smin pas gnas pa rnams ni de la 'bad pa'i rtsom pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhi ba'i rnam par thar pa'i rnam par smin pas gnas pa rnams ni de la 'bad pa'i rtsom pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because those who abide in the result of the liberation of peace do not make an effort to actualize it.

original: lam chung ngu gang zhe na /
analyzed: lam chung ngu gang zhe na /
translated: What is the small path?

original: chung ngu'i dang / chung ngu'i 'bring po dang / chung ngu'i chen po ste /
analyzed: chung ngu'i dang / chung ngu'i 'bring po dang / chung ngu'i chen po ste /
translated: It is the small of the small, the middling of the small, and the great of the small.

original: gang gis sa dang sa na khams gsum na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams kyi nyon mongs pa'i rnam pa chen po'i chen @95b po dang / chen po'i 'bring po dang / chen po'i chung ngu spong ba'o //
analyzed: gang gis sa dang sa na khams gsum na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams kyi nyon mongs pa'i rnam pa chen po'i chen @95b po dang / chen po'i 'bring po dang / chen po'i chung ngu spong ba'o //
translated: It is that by which one abandons the great of the great, the middling of the great, and the small of the great aspects of the defilements that occur in the three realms, on each stage.

original: lam 'bring po gang zhe na /
analyzed: lam 'bring po gang zhe na /
translated: What is the middling path?

original: 'bring po'i chung ngu dang / 'bring po'i 'bring po dang / 'bring po'i chen po ste /
analyzed: 'bring po'i chung ngu dang / 'bring po'i 'bring po dang / 'bring po'i chen po ste /
translated: It is the small of the middling, the middling of the middling, and the great of the middling.

original: gang gis sa dang sa na khams gsum na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams kyi nyon mongs pa'i rnam pa 'bring po'i chen po dang ; 'bring po'i 'bring po dang / 'bring po'i chung du spong pa'o //
analyzed: gang gis sa dang sa na khams gsum na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams kyi nyon mongs pa'i rnam pa 'bring po'i chen po dang ; 'bring po'i 'bring po dang / 'bring po'i chung du spong pa'o //
translated: It is the path by which one abandons the medium of the medium, the medium of the small, and the small of the small defilements of the three realms, in the different stages.

original: lam chen po gang zhe na /üîΩchen po'i chung ngu dang / chen po'i 'bring po dang / chen po'i chen po ste /
analyzed: lam chen po gang zhe na / chen po'i chung ngu dang / chen po'i 'bring po dang / chen po'i chen po ste /
translated: What is the great path?üîΩIt is the path by which one abandons the great of the great, the medium of the great, and the small of the great defilements of the three realms, in the different stages.

original: gang gis sa dang sa na khams su gsum na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams kyi nyon mongs pa'i rnam pa chung ngu'i chen po dang / chung ngu'i 'bring po dang / chung ngu'i chung ngu spong ba'o //
analyzed: gang gis sa dang sa na khams su gsum na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams kyi nyon mongs pa'i rnam pa chung ngu'i chen po dang / chung ngu'i 'bring po dang / chung ngu'i chung ngu spong ba'o //
translated: It is the path by which one abandons the great of the small, the medium of the small, and the small of the small defilements of the three realms, in the different stages.

original: sbyor ba'i lam gang zhe na /
analyzed: sbyor ba'i lam gang zhe na /
translated: What is the path of application?

original: gang gis nyon mongs pa spong ba'o //
analyzed: gang gis nyon mongs pa spong ba'o //
translated: It is the path by which one abandons the defilements.

original: bar chad med pa'i lam gang zhe na /üîΩgang gi 'og tu bar chad med par nyon mongs pa spong bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: bar chad med pa'i lam gang zhe na / gang gi 'og tu bar chad med par nyon mongs pa spong bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: What is the path without conflict?üîΩIt is the path which follows immediately after the path of application.

original: rnam par grol ba'i lam gang zhe na /
analyzed: rnam par grol ba'i lam gang zhe na /
translated: What is the path of liberation?

original: gang gis nyon mongs pa spongs nas rnam par grol ba mngon du byed pa'o //
analyzed: gang gis nyon mongs pa spongs nas rnam par grol ba mngon du byed pa'o //
translated: It is the path by which one abandons the defilements and realizes deliverance.

original: khyad par gyi lam gang zhe na /
analyzed: khyad par gyi lam gang zhe na /
translated: What is the special path?

original: nyon mongs pa'i rnam pa de las gzhan pa la sbyor ba dang / bar chad med pa dang / rnam par grol ba'i lam ni khyad par gyi lam mo //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i rnam pa de las gzhan pa la sbyor ba dang / bar chad med pa dang / rnam par grol ba'i lam ni khyad par gyi lam mo //
translated: The path of application, the immediate path and the path of liberation, which are different from the preceding paths, are the special paths.

original: yang nyon mongs pa spong ba'i sbyor ba bsal nas /üîΩchos sems pa'am /üîΩzhugs pa'i chos la gnas pa'am /üîΩsnyoms par 'jug pa'i khyad par gyi lam gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: yang nyon mongs pa spong ba'i sbyor ba bsal nas / chos sems pa'am / zhugs pa'i chos la gnas pa'am / snyoms par 'jug pa'i khyad par gyi lam gang yin pa'o //
translated: Moreover, the path of application for the abandoning of the defilements being set aside,üîΩthe path of application for the cultivation of the special qualities,

original: yang yon tan khyad par can rnams mngon par bsgrub pa'am /
analyzed: yang yon tan khyad par can rnams mngon par bsgrub pa'am /
translated: the path of application for the acquisition of the superknowledges,

original: gnas pa'i lam gang yin pa'o //üîΩlam bsgom pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: gnas pa'i lam gang yin pa'o // lam bsgom pa gang zhe na /
translated: the path of application for the acquisition of the unhindered knowledges,üîΩthe path of application for the acquisition of the analytical knowledges,üîΩthe path of application for the acquisition of the dhƒÅra·πáƒ´s,üîΩthe path of application for the acquisition of the superknowledges,

original: thob par bya ba'i phyir bsgom pa dang / bsten pa'i bsgom pa dang / bsal ba'i phyir bsgom pa dang / gnyen po bsgom pa'o //üîΩthob par bya ba'i phyir bsgom pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: thob par bya ba'i phyir bsgom pa dang / bsten pa'i bsgom pa dang / bsal ba'i phyir bsgom pa dang / gnyen po bsgom pa'o //üîΩthob par bya ba'i phyir bsgom pa gang zhe na /
